thread.title: Proposed transit changes could affect 100,000 commuters
thread.title_full: Proposed transit changes could affect 100,000 commuters | www.kirotv.com

author: kirotv.com
title: Proposed transit changes could affect 100,000 commuters
text:
The King County Council will vote on transit changes that could impact 100,000 commuters Monday.
Under the proposed plan, more buses will drop people off at new light rail stations on Capitol Hill and in the University District instead of going all the way to downtown Seattle.
But at a public meeting two weeks ago, many commuters spoke out against the idea.
The changes would mostly impact routes on the northeast side of Seattle. Many say the changes will make their commutes a lot harder.
“Metro has given the short end of the stick to riders of northeast Seattle,” said commuter Jack Papegaay.
“This restructure would take effect in March of next year and it needs to be done right,” said King County Councilmember Rod Dembowski.
Supporters of the plan say the tradeoff of transferring on to light rail from a bus will be a more frequent and reliable ride to downtown.
The hearing is at 1:30 p.m. Monday.
See the list of recommended changes here .
